summary: This document is an email chain discussing a Yahoo Lifestyle article about Prince Harry commenting on Prince Andrew's friendship with Jeffrey Epstein in a prank phone call. The emails highlight the article's estimated publicity value and readership, indicating media monitoring of the Epstein case's connection to British royalty.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Subject of the Yahoo Lifestyle article discussing his friendship with Jeffrey Epstein, as commented on by Prince Harry in a prank phone call.

persons.name: Prince Harry
persons.context: Made comments about Prince Andrew's friendship with Jeffrey Epstein during a prank phone call, as reported in the Yahoo Lifestyle article.

persons.name: Megan Markel
persons.context: Mentioned as being in the same news story as Prince Andrew and Prince Harry regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case; his friendship with Prince Andrew is the subject of the media article being discussed.

connections.description: Friendship discussed in a media article, with Prince Harry commenting on it.
Prince Harry commented on Prince Andrew's association with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Media Article on Prince Harry's Comments
events.description: Yahoo Lifestyle publishes an article titled 'Prince Harry Comments on Prince Andrew's Friendship with Jeffrey Epstein in Prank Phone Call'.

keyFacts: A Yahoo Lifestyle article about Prince Harry commenting on Prince Andrew's friendship with Jeffrey Epstein had an estimated 231,333,672 readers.
The article was estimated to have over $4 million in publicity value.
The email chain shows media monitoring and discussion of the Epstein case's connection to British royalty in March 2020.
The correspondence highlights the significant public and media interest in the associations between Jeffrey Epstein and high-profile individuals like Prince Andrew.
